headline.main: Teenagers Should Talk About Both Fat and Thin

docs.abstract: D C Chesler letter, commenting on Dec 19 article about teenager girls learning to resist pressures to to be thin, says the girls should also be made aware of hazards of obesity
docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor: The teenager in Felicia R. Lee's Dec. 19 Coping column (''The Body Beautiful, in Diverse Guises'') may not ''explode.'' However, she may be headed for serious health problems. It is not O.K. to overeat or ignore proper diet. Obesity is a serious health problem, particularly in children. It is prevalent in minority communities.
